newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Canberra raises cap on two family visa groups.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Canberra raises cap on two family visa groups.

text.p: Australian Immigration Minister Philip Ruddock said on Monday the government would raise the cap on two visa classes within the preferential family category.
"The cap on fiance visas will be raised from 1,500 to 3,000 places and the cap for interdependent visas granted to on-shore will be raised from 200 to 300 places," Ruddock said in a statement.
These changes would not affect the overall planning levels of 36,700 for the preferential family category and 74,000 for the total migration programme for fiscal year 1996/97, Ruddock said.
"A reduction in the application rates across the preferential family category has enabled the government to review some of the caps that are currently set for parts of the programme," he said.

The Liberal-National government announced in July it would cut its general immigration intake by 10.8 percent in the next year, introducing English language tests for migrants in a move reflecting concerns over high unemployment.
When the announcement was made Prime Minister John Howard said Australia would maintain a non-discriminatory immigration policy.
Instead the government would select migrants with better English language skills, better work skills, and greater ability to contribute quickly to national wealth, Howard said.
